pros: There are some amazing people that work at Concordia and everyone is very inviting. You will develop great friendships and have many talks about how tight money is, even though you are constantly working.
cons: Where does all the money go? You can access public records of this school and see how much the president and coaches are making. It's pretty much a spit in the face of everyone at the ground level trying to get by.

review_title: Half Person Pay for Three Person Job
pros: Decent benefits, great ambiance at work, good coworkers
cons: Accounting department is poorly managed and severely understaffed.

pros: Dedicated to students' education and success.
cons: Build upon all departments within healthcare.

pros: Nicest people you will ever work with.
cons: Narrow minded. Unaware of changing trends, and student dissatisfaction.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Instructor in Irvine, CA

cons: Pay is nowhere near enough for the amount of work this position requires

pros: flexible and understanding manager of the tutoring center.

job_title: University Services Program Associate in Irvine, CA
pros: As a worker, I have been treated well. Bosses are nice and the schedule is flexible.
cons: I have seen many students mistreated in my time within the organization.

pros: You can get 50% graduate tuition.
cons: They only hire within the religious community

pros: Great people who work here. Certain teams have more flexible than others.
cons: No growth opportunities for non-LCMS church members.

pros: CUI is a great support system. If you need something, your higher-ups will do their best to advocate for you and make it happen.
cons: Change/innovation is very slow going here. It seems like every department operates on a different system and sometimes it's hard to collaborate when needed.

pros: Relaxed office environment. Great people.

review_title: Was a wonderful place to work
job_title: Library Student Worker in Irvine, CA
pros: Flexible around school schedule with great bosses
cons: Cant think of any cons to include

job_title: Graphic Design Intern in Irvine, CA
pros: The community is great and I fully support their mission statement!
cons: I don't have any cons.

job_title: Business & Community Liaison in Irvine, CA
pros: A few of my co-workers are decent people. But, after time, low pay, lack of advancement, and leadership that doesn't listen to the "boots on the ground" kills the spirit and morale of just about everyone.
cons: Too many to make a comprehensive list. It started by being put into a position that wasn't suited to my skills and talents. In over 3 years I was never fully utilized, virtually never valued, and repeatedly harassed. It is truly an "old boys club" of WASP LCMS men. If you aren't one of them, or an elderly woman who is happy to be an admin for little pay and keep your ideas to yourself - this is NOT the place for you.

job_title: Admissions Counselor Assistant in Irvine, CA
pros: Your role is communicated clearly and the rest of the team is there to help you. Hours are adjusted to your schedule with no problems. A sense of fulfillment is gained after doing what your called to do in the job description.
cons: Sometimes hard to know if there is going to be growth for you in the company.

review_title: Compensation for the amount of work required is low
pros: I love working for a Christian organization.
cons: Poor leadership and management decisions.  Company does not provide you with the training and tools you need to be successful in your job.  Employees are not rewarded for outstanding reviews.

pros: Very nice faculty and staff
cons: No diversity in the faculty, and most do not want to address diversity.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in San Diego, CA
pros: Concordia is a great University to work for and provide the Adjunct Professors with both a Comprehensive and up to date Curriculum.
cons: Limited classes depending on cohort size.

pros: Definitely feel the community feeling among the co-workers.
cons: More communication between departments. More  distinct pay scale among the student workers depending on grade level and prior experience.

job_title: International Program Coordinator in Irvine, CA
pros: Loyalty to employees promotes loyalty to employer
cons: Communication speed is deficient in some areas

pros: It is nice working in a Christian environment. Some of the benefits outweigh the low compensation you receive for your hard work.
cons: Low pay and no compensation for your hard work. You are expected to work for a low salary because it's consider your ministry.

review_title: Friendly people but can be insular and challenging for minorities
